attributes.action: Organise a concert at Wembley to celebrate immigrants living & working in the UK
attributes.background: Immigrants living & working in the UK make a huge and positive contribution to our society. Many feel unsettled and anxious following the Referendum vote. We want them to know that they remain welcome in the UK and HM Govt should organise a concert at Wembley to celebrate their contribution.

attributes.action: Seize this opportunity to reform the EU by offering an alternative system.
attributes.background: Across Europe much dissatisfaction is being heard, with membership referenda being called for in many other countries. We have the world's best diplomats. This is an opportunity for us to seize the initiative in constructing a Europe Mk II that  recognises sovereignty but encourages free trade.

attributes.action: Protect health and pension rights  of British nationals resident in EU states.
attributes.background: The health and pension rights of British citizens living in EU states are protected by reciprocal arrangements (eg, the calculation of a person's pension based on  contributions made in more than one country); these rights must be part of any ageements negotiated during the Brexit process.

attributes.action: NHS, Fire, and Police, pay no income tax if earning below the national average.
attributes.background: My partner is a newly qualified neonatal nurse caring for seriously ill babies and as an example earns less than our postman for the same hours.
attributes.additional_details: Paying income tax means that part of their salary goes back to the NHS that employs them.

attributes.action: Offer more medical school places
attributes.background: The GMC limit the number of places avaliable for students studying medicine at university. By keeping the number of places the same, doctors numbers within the NHS won't rise putting patient care at risk. By offering more places longer term the NHS can employ more doctors and improve patient care

attributes.action: Lower the tax rate for health care workers
attributes.background: I request that the government consider lowering the tax rate of 20% over the threshold to 15% for health care workers on lower wages such as care assistance, Nurses. Currently health care workers are many paid at the living wage.

attributes.action: make it illegal to buy or sell animals within 1 month before Christmas
attributes.background: Many animals are sent to shelters as unwanted xmas presents right after xmas
attributes.additional_details: Leeds Dogs trust has received 500 calls re rehoming since xmas and this is just one city and this is repeated all over the country

attributes.action: Reduce the speed limit on single track rural lanes from 60mph to 30mph
attributes.background: Increased traffic using badly maintained single track rural lanes as alternative routes and for commercial purposes is putting unacceptable pressure on the infrastructure and rural population. The legal speed limit of 60mph needs reducing to 30mph for the safety of families, workers and other users.
attributes.additional_details:
The urban population of the UK 80% so 20% are rural dwellers. Why are 59% of fatalities in the UK on rural roads?
http://www.rospa.com/road-safety/advice/road-users/rural/
Many single track rural roads are horse tracks over 100 years old, now supporting repeated commercial use by carriers, sat nav alternatives to the clogged main routes and increasing leisure activities. There are no pavements or lighting leave home on foot with a buggy straight on to a road with a 60mph limit - unacceptable.

attributes.action: Improve the quality and amount of PE in schools and spend more on school dinners
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students at Greenwood Academy in Birmingham. We are campaigning to increase the amount of PE lessons in school and improve the quality of them in order to help get students healthier. We also feel school dinners lack the nutrition necessary to have healthier young people.

attributes.action: Set a minimum standard for baby change and feed facilities in food outlets
attributes.background: Having seen my wife breastfeed our 3-month old daughter in numerous baby/parent facilities of varying hygiene and quality, I believe there should be a government-set minimum standard for dedicated rooms including all the following - baby change table, toilet, sink, paper towels and a feeding chair.
attributes.additional_details:
John Lewis and Fenwick's are companies setting high standards.  I have visited worse including M&S stores who combine baby facilities with a disabled toilet (no chair/poor hygiene) and Tesco (no toilet), whilst several Costa branches don't have anywhere private to sit so feeding has to be done standing up in the toilet.
As a father I see my wife feeding our baby in conditions that are poor and unhygienic for both parent/child, whilst I experience the lack of toilet facilities in changing areas.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory in England for Air Gun Licensing.
attributes.background: I think it should be made compulsory to stop people going in public places, ie woods and shooting anything that moves.
attributes.additional_details: I have been out with my dog and experienced a youth pointing a gun at my dog. As a license holder myself i believe that any gun, ie air pistol or air rifle you should have to hold a license for as you do with any other gun to stop these type of guns falling into the wrong hands.

attributes.action: 2017 to be the year that the UK start protecting native wildlife In our cities.
attributes.background: Our wildlife is losing it's natural habitat & struggling to adjust to our cities.In this unknown future in the UK due to Brexit.I ask you to firstly pledge your assurance to keep EU laws on our enviroment.Secondly, a guarantee that the goverment will help make our cities accessible to wildlife.
attributes.additional_details: This is important for our wildlife in the UK.In Milan over 800 trees have been planted on rooftops & balconies resulting in species abundance growth.This could be achieved in the UK with help from university students of Enviromental sciences.This cuts costs &helps students develop skills& portfolios,which could lead to job growth.If achieved,this could attract tourists to cities throughout the UK& boost our economy.There is no doubt that our wildlife,worldwide is depleting at a dangerous rate.

attributes.action: Divert 50% of the foreign aid budget to tackle social care for the aged in uk
attributes.background: More councils in the uk are short of funds to tackle social care in the UK.(12 billion foreign aid budget wasted on rogue nations/state officials), to go directly to councils, so that they do not in turn raise their taxes, which are currently too high now.
attributes.additional_details: This will help to pay for more care homes and after care for the elderly and release more beds in hospitals so that we can all benefit. With an ageing population, If this situation is not tackled this way, then bigger problems will arise. It is on best affordable way forward to this and still retains 50% of the foreign aid budget, which should be more scrutinised than currently is or scrapped altogether.

attributes.action: give expats the vote in future referendums
attributes.background: I am petitioning to give expats from the UK the vote in any future referendum in the UK.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for Under 25's to £7.50 in line with all other workers.
attributes.background: Young people can be paid considerably less for work than an adult, in the same role at the same company; U18's can be paid as little as £4.05 per hour & U21 £5.60; This pay gap is discriminatory legislation, which says YP are worth less than older citizens (Regardless of ability to perform the job.)
attributes.additional_details:
It's near impossible to live a decent quality of life on earnings around the minimum wage; So why for under 25's who work in the same roles as adults can be paid £3.45p/h less an hour despite being potentially better educated more capable than their adult counterparts. Many under 25's work their jobs to help low-income parents provide necessities and I feel this discriminatory legislation therefore unfairly targets the young people of low-income backgrounds who are just about managing to cover the costs of running a household...

I therefore petition the government for pay equity for under 25's.

attributes.action: Stop the closure of the West Midlands Ambulance base at Aston Fire Station!
attributes.background: The West Midlands Ambulance Services central base is at the Aston Fire Station. Due to the Council saying they are no longer able to fund this they are planning to close the base unless they can raise £50,000! This would make Northfield and Erdington the next closest ambulance bases.
attributes.additional_details:
Anybody who has needed an Ambulance in an emergency for themselves or loved ones will know that minutes really matter, in a situation that requires immediate treatment those minutes really are the difference between life and death. The extra few miles these crews would have to travel will be costing vital seconds, even those of you outside Birmingham know the importance of the emergency services and their ability to respond quickly. Please sign and share, Thankyou
http://www.wmas.nhs.uk/about-us

attributes.action: Drink in customers use of takeaway cups to be banned due to high waste volume
attributes.background: I work for one of the large chain high street coffee shops and I find it  astounding how much waste is created in these establishments alone, the worst needless waste I have seen is customers requesting takeaway cups to sit in. This needs to stop or legislation brought in to discourage this.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 3 Billion disposable coffee cups are used every year in the UK with only 1% being recycled. It is becoming an issue which can not be ignored. I understand that asking people to not use takeaway cups and bring their own is unrealistic but stopping the use of takeaway cups for sit in customers would be a fantastic start towards ending the practice and the needless waste created.

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/mar/16/takeaway-coffee-cups-recycle-environment-waste

attributes.action: Force negotiations between company bosses and unions to be made public
attributes.background:
In the run up to Christmas, unions have tactfully made yet another play for a pay rise using the holiday season as an opportunity to disrupt people's lives and demand better conditions.

Yet discussions at conciliatory services, such as ACAS, are rarely made public beyond their highlights
attributes.additional_details:
We request that negotiations, such as those taking place at ACAS be recorded and made public, so that we the people affect, often paying customers, have a clearer understanding. We believe unions and bosses alike will strongly endorse this measure as they have nothing to hide with regards to what their negotiating positions are.

Furthermore, it will give the public an opportunity to weigh in on what they think a fair deal is for staff at these organisations

attributes.action: Dont allow food companies to add air to food packages to make them look bigger.
attributes.background: Food manufacturers are filling food packages with air. This is wrong as we are being tricked to buying food and finding out that in food packaging a small percentage is actual food and a large percentage is filled with air! Food with packaging should have a limit to the amount of air it has.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence that manufacturers are filling food packages with air-

http://www.msn.com/en-gb/foodanddrink/foodnews/shocking-x-ray-images-reveal-how-food-manufacturers-are-cheating-shoppers-by-filling-packages-with-air/ar-AAltXRN?li=AAcVLvg&ocid=spartandhp

attributes.action: Ban Triclosan from UK products
attributes.background: The USA Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has banned hand soaps containing triclosan, after ruling that the antibacterial chemical could contribute to antibiotic resistance. Triclosan and other potentially harmful antibacterial chemicals are widely used  in hand washes, deodorants and toothpastes

attributes.action: Free to Use Gym Facilities for Under 18s in Full Time Education.
attributes.background: Currently, Childhood Obesity stands at about 20% and could increase just like the last 20 years. I think it should be required to have Gym Facilities in Schools and/or a free membership to Local Gyms for Under 18s in Full Time Education to reduce Obesity in Children and Teenagers.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-03-21/facts-about-the-uks-growing-obesity-crisis/

http://www.noo.org.uk/NOO_about_obesity/child_obesity

attributes.action: Promote responsible drinking by enforced water stations in pubs, bars and clubs
attributes.background:
Significantly reduce incidents and Public Sectors costs, following other countries' lead by highlighting re-hydration in establishments with alcohol consumption. 
Eliminate queuing up and faux pas amongst peers by having water and electrolyte fluids available in prominent areas relative to capacity
attributes.additional_details:
Alcohol related incidents cost the public sector millions which can be significantly reduced by having easily identifiable water stations in all establishments. 

This can be done by having large containers or a simple bar tap facing the customer and also through encouragement of re-hydration electrolytes in between and after alcoholic drinks. 

NSW in Australia has a similar project already in place and the UK government should follow suit benefiting individuals and the greater community.

attributes.action: Allow 14-15 year olds to consent to sex with someone a maximum of 3 years older
attributes.background: The age of consent is currently 16, and therefore those aged below 16 are prohibited from engaging in sexual; whether protected or unprotected. My proposal is that 14 year olds should be allowed to engage in sexual activity; but only protected, and with partners who are no more than 3 years older.
attributes.additional_details: The age of consent in the UK has been 16 since 1885. Sex education has improved since 1885, and so 14 year-olds nowadays are capable of consenting to safe sex and understand the implications. Most countries in Europe have a lower age of consent than we do, which has led to calls to reduce ours. However, I believe that this is a dangerous move with paedophilia being so common today, and so I believe that my proposal is the best option. Various US states follow legislation similar to my proposal.

attributes.action: Make Helium Balloons Illegal
attributes.background: I am always seeing helium balloons. Helium is a limited resource so should not be used for balloons, especially as helium can be used for important MRI scanners. This gas is lighter than air and will never be seen again if it floats away. So please support me in my hope to ban helium balloons.
attributes.additional_details:
When pressure becomes too much for a balloon it will pop, and the foil balloon will land in the ocean- a innocent sea creature will eat it and die.
Helium is a limited resource and is needed for MRI scanners to work. Helium is the only element out of all 118 in the periodic table that can cool the electromagnets to the right temperature for the scanner to work. One day helium may save your life.

attributes.action: A life sentence to mean life imprisonment.
attributes.background: A life sentence handed out to criminals should mean they spend the rest of their life behind bars with no option for early release
attributes.additional_details: All too often we hear of people being sentenced for horrific crimes and murders and are told they've been given a 'life sentence ' of which they must serve a minimum of 4 years or something ridiculous like that. Life should mean life, to combat the response of "we don't have the money or the space" - in these cases bring back the death penalty for murderers and child abusers who show no remorse and stop imprisoning people for petty offences like 'possession of cannabis'

attributes.action: Prioritise implementation of the alternative student finance product
attributes.background: Many Muslims are unable to attend university, because their faith prohibits them from taking interest based loans to fund tuition fees.The government has acknowledged this and have developed an alternative financing model.This needs to be made available so that more students can attend university
attributes.additional_details:
Links to previous developments;

2014 consultation
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/349899/bis-14-984-government-response-to-a-consultation-on-a-sharia-compliant-alternative-finance-product.pdf

White Paper 2016
Page 56- Alternative student finance offer
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/523546/bis-16-265-success-as-a-knowledge-economy-web.pdf

For information on developments visit
http://www.halalstudentloans.co.uk/

attributes.action: Limit the resale of event tickets to a maximum of double the face value
attributes.background: Recently I have attempted to purchase tickets for my favourite artists, only to find that they are sold out in seconds.  If this was by genuine fans, then I'd understand. However, its not.  Immediately on checking Stubhub, there are hundreds available that people are buying to make profits from.
attributes.additional_details: Adele tickets, Face Value £123.00 selling for over £1500 on stub hub within 12 minutes of the sale going live.

attributes.action: Stop government deducting pensions
attributes.background: Stop ex-serviceman having their army pension deducted from their current benefit
attributes.additional_details: Just been called in to the job centre as part of my partner's ESA claim to find out that my army pension will be deducted from her ESA claim at the rate of £25 per week why having served 16 years in the army I know there are people worse off than me but I think it's a crying shame that ex servicemen who have given up their time to serve their country be penalised in later in life please find this position and get the government to change this the pension was rightfully earned and now the government of rightly taking it away from us why

attributes.action: Introduce £50 charge for calling an ambulance for non-emergency conditions.
attributes.background: The answer to over-crowded A&E and queueing ambulances isn't more money, it is to stop people using ambulances as a taxi service or for minor ailments. The ambulance crews have to treat you if you call them but too many people are abusing this service. A charge for mis-use would cut own demand.

attributes.action: Make all tax on income, business rates and revenue fair and consistent
attributes.background: Companies making billions in revenue from operating in the UK can take advantage of tax loopholes, government deals and reduced tax rates, yet the burden of the tax bill is being paid by the average employee being taxed on a basic rate of 20% and national insurance at 13.8%. PAYE needs to be fairer.
attributes.additional_details:
The government will reduce the amount of corporation tax paid by businesses to 17% by 2020, yet if you are an employee on a standard PAYE system you're taxed at a basic rate of 20% which can increase up to 45%. How is this right?

You can not take advantage of these rates, tax is taken automatically from your salary every month. The government continues to give tax breaks to the people that own these companies, not the employees that are paying a disproportionate tax rate to their employers.

attributes.action: Increase Defence Spending to 2.5% of GDP.
attributes.background: NATO guidelines put 2% of GDP as the minimum defence spending for NATO countries. I point out the key word: MINIMUM. 2% is the bare minimum. It is not a "target". We must endeavour to bring our capabilities back up to adequate standards after careless, thoughtless cuts in the SDSR 2010 & 2015.
attributes.additional_details: It is a simple fact that when HMS Queen Elizabeth comes into service 13 Frigates and 6 Destroyers simply won't be adequate to form a Carrier Group whilst maintaining other global operations. We require AT LEAST 8 Type 26's, 12 T-31's and another 2 Destroyers. The RAF can only muster a pathetic 36 Jets whilst Saudi was deploying 100+ daily in Yemen. We call for immediate action to boost spending to 2.5% of GDP as to regain basic, minimum capability as quickly & efficiently as possible.

attributes.action: Cyclists should complete a road safety test and pay for insurance and road tax.
attributes.background: Over the last few years there has been a increase in road accidents involving cyclists. Some accidents happen through a complete lack of road sense. It is dangerous to the cyclists and especially to drivers on the road. Cyclists should also pay for road tax and be insured if they are using the road.

attributes.action: Grant legal rights of bodily liberty/integrity to apes, dolphins & elephants.
attributes.background: International scientific studies on genetics, intelligence, emotions and the social lives of these animals have proven to shown these animals are self-aware, autonomous beings.

attributes.action: Amend voting age to reflect the school year
attributes.background:
This petition aims to grant the right to vote to second-year college students; in other words, to 17-year-olds who will pass their 18th birthday within the same school year as the vote.

We should recognise that students in the same school year have the same intellectual and cultural maturity.
attributes.additional_details:
To make an adequate generalisation about the societal and cultural awareness of young people, it would make much more sense to rely on their years of education; limiting voting by age is arbitrary.

For example, in the General Election 2015, students in their final year of college were only eligible to vote depending on whether their 18th birthday fell before or after May 7th. We should recognise that a period of a few days is inconsequential.

Colleges could then encourage youth participation.

attributes.action: Include Religious Studies as a Humanities subject in the English Baccalaureate.
attributes.background: The exclusion of RS from the EBacc is leading to a reduction in the overall understanding of religion in the UK, and suggests that RS is an unimportant subject. In a world increasingly defined by a lack of understanding of religious belief, this is a clear mistake by the Government.

attributes.action: Increase National Minimum Wage to a minimum of £20/£25 per hour.
attributes.background: Increase the National Minimum Wage to a fair and decent level so those at the lower end of the employment ladder don't just have to survive or fight tooth and nail to get by. Instead of giving people 'benefits' like Tax Credits use that money to reduce Business Taxes so employers can cover the cost.
attributes.additional_details:
People would rather earn a decent wage than feel like they have to be supported on benefits by the government.

Reducing business taxes in this way would encourage more business to set up and invest in their companies. Also would encourage more businesses to set up in the UK.

The government spends an estimated £30 billion a year on Tax Credit. Don't give handouts to people give them a decent wage and some pride in themselves.

attributes.action: Government must restrict FIFA officials travel to the UK pending a full apology
attributes.background: It is at the government's discretion to restrict access to the UK of those deemed to be unconducive to the public interest. FIFA decision to enter into disciplinary proceedings against both the English & Scottish teams for wearing the universal emblem of remembrance the poppy is just that.
attributes.additional_details: Civilised cultures remember those who made the ultimate sacrifice in defending freedom, the wearing of the poppy isn't restricted to remembering British fallen but those of the commonwealth and respect of those who thought against us in the hope their sacrifice wasn't in vain. The poppy isn't a political image but one of hope/respect and even reconsideration. Any travel ban on FIFA officials should stand until such time as a full and unconditional apology is made to both nations teams by FIFA.

attributes.action: Stop Dover Harbour Board dredging the Goodwin Sands.
attributes.background: Dover Harbour Board want to extract marine aggregate from the Goodwins. Home to 350 grey seals and the some 2,000 shipwrecks. We are already susceptible to erosion. Beach recharging works are constant. Flooding along the East Kent coast is continual problem which would be exacerbated by dredging.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a current petition to raise awareness, as detailed below.
https://you.38degrees.org.uk/petitions/goodwin-sands-sos-stop-the-dredge
This has reached over 12,000 signatures.
Please help save the Goodwin Sands and their neighbouring environment from the destruction of dredging by signing this petition today and also by writing to the Marine Management Organisation with your concerns.
Letters can be emailed to marine.consents@marinemanagement.org.uk quoting the reference 
MLA/2016/00227.

attributes.action: Employers to give mothers returning from maternity leave flexible working hours.
attributes.background: This is an issue that many mothers have wrongly encountered. We as mothers should be given the right to have flexible working hours that balance our home and work life. We should not be discriminated for having children.
attributes.additional_details: Applying for flexible working hours to be abolished. Mothers should be offered flexible hours in their current position or offered in same grade position elsewhere. If this is not feasible, lower grade flexible working position.

attributes.action: Lower the sound limit of fireworks that can be sold to the public 50 decibels
attributes.background: A petition has recently gone around asking to ban the sale of fireworks to the public, and the response has been somewhat disappointing. As a compromise we are asking to lower the sound limit from 120 to 50 decibels to minimise stress on animals and people.

attributes.action: Investigate the link between 3G Football pitches and cancer.
attributes.background: 3G Football pitches are made from crumb rubber, pellets of which are often made from used car tyres, which contain toxic chemicals. It has been suggested that if these chemicals enter the body through, for example, cuts or scratches then they can contribute to Cancer.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35585392
http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/10154596/report-claims-link-between-3g-pitches-and-cancer

attributes.action: Prevent companies from automatically opting us in to third party marketing.
attributes.background: When calling various service providers such as car insurance companies, housing insurance, mobile phone companies there is often a prerecorded massage at the start of the call stating that they will pass on your details to third party companies for marketing purposes, you need to ask to be opted out
attributes.additional_details:
Having spent 20 minutes online trying to get car insurance quotes and speaking to 1 company who had a similar pre recorded message that was unable to provide the required service I have been plagued by sales calls trying to sell me similar and unrelated products due to being automatically opted in.

This practice is wrong and parasitic, if companies want to sell or benefit from marketing your details they should be the ones asking, the burden to opt out should not be placed on the consumer.

attributes.action: Add the option for 'None of the Above' on Local / General Election Ballot Papers
attributes.background: Voting is being effected by the lack of a direct, quantifiable outlet for frustrated people to express themselves.It causes negative voting and confused issues. People should have a way to say candidates/campaigns tactics are not good enough;if say 25% reached a rerun with new candidates triggered.
attributes.additional_details: Voting should be a positive experience. i.e FOR someone or something. Too often, the choice is often about the 'least worst option'. The ballot paper needs to give a credible alternative.The electorate needs a way to encourage postive campaigning and ultimately reject a set of bad candidates.I believe by giving everyone the option of quanitfiably registering their frustration with candidates/campaigns we can force politicians away from devisive language and personal attacks & increase turn out.

attributes.action: Scrap High Speed 2 (HS2). Put forward Hyperloop for consideration.
attributes.background:
HS2 provides minimal gains over our existing rail infrastructure. The cost/ benefit ratio is unacceptable to the taxpayer at £55 billion.

If the UK is to spend this sort of money on a transport project, we should be making substantial leaps.
attributes.additional_details:
This could be achieved by implementing Hyperloop technology instead.

With recent announcements from other nations investing in Hyperloop technology, there is a very real worry that if we commit to HS2, the UK will be investing in the wrong choice. 

We'll end up with an overpriced, lacklustre rail technology that is obsolete before the project even gets started.

attributes.action: Impose a life long ban for HGV drivers caught driving while using mobile device
attributes.background: I suggest that any HGV driver caught driving whilst using a mobile device, should be issued a instant life long ban. In view of the amount of accidents and deaths caused by this. If applicable an additional fine to the registered keeper of £5000.00 should be issued.
attributes.additional_details: I suggest that any HGV driver caught driving whilst using a mobile device, should be issued a instant life long ban. In view of the amount of accidents and deaths caused by this. If applicable an additional fine to the registered keeper of £5000.00 should be issued. UK courts should also have the power to ban foreign drivers to the UK upon presentation of their licences at UK ports.

attributes.action: Lower the curfew of fireworks to 9pm on a normal night
attributes.background: The curfew for fireworks should be lowered to 9pm on a normal night because little children go to bed at 9pm & dogs will not be afraid for too long & their owners will be able to get to sleep not worrying about there pets.

attributes.action: Stop premium rate mobile phone service subscriptions without confirmatory text
attributes.background: Many mobile phone users have found themselves subscribed to premium rate services which are charged to their phone bills simply because they closed an unwanted pop up advert while browsing the internet. There is no cooling off period, and usually no confirmation text so bill payer is not aware!
attributes.additional_details: To stop the charges being levied unfairly there should be a 14 day cooling off period before any service charges, secondly, as many of these services don't send a confirmation text that a subscription has been set up the mobile phone user may not know. The law must be changed to stop these unfair subscriptions and charges.

attributes.action: Stop the UK selling arms to any side of the Syrian conflict
attributes.background: The only way of ending the conflict in Syria is to stop supplying sides with arms. The UK government has a responsibility to ensure that any involvement in conflicts do not harm the citizens of that country or make the situation worse. Arming any side in Syria is prolonging the conflict.
attributes.additional_details: It is time to do what we can to help Syrian citizens and stop our involvement.

attributes.action: Never sign a trade deal like CETA/TTIP which cede UK sovereignty to corporations
attributes.background: Once Brexit has completed, the UK will be able to enter into trade deals by itself. Ministerial support for TTIP/CETA which are aimed at eroding national sovereignty and giving multinational corporations the right to sue governments if policy adversely effects their profits is a serious danger.
attributes.additional_details: The main tenet of the Brexit campaign was to "take back control" from the EU. UK ministers have voiced strong support for CETA/TTIP which seems contradictory given that such trade deals put the sovereignty of government in doubt and give corporations the ability to sue governments under Investor-State Dispute Settlement powers before special international tribunals. This would effectively bring an end to the cherished principle of equality before the law, all in the name of greater profits.

attributes.action: Do not build an extra runway at any London airport. Increase efficiency.
attributes.background: Rather than spending millions on building a new runway we need to better use what airports we have and increase the speed and efficiency of public transport. If we are to meet global CO2 reduction targets this is of paramount importance. Air travel needs not be idolised.
attributes.additional_details: CO2 concentrations are increasing and this is causing global temperatures to rise. Rather than focusing on increased capacity for air travel, encouraging it, we need to better use the airports we have and link them with better (and greener) public transport. This is of paramount importance if we are serious about anthropogenic climate change and considering the Paris agreement. Perhaps we could create jobs in tree-planting, conservation and green energy instead?
